sentences.sentence: Retired NATO General Petro Pavel has beaten a billionaire former prime minister in an election runoff to become the fourth president of the Czech Republic.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: A cry for justice in Memphis, Tennessee.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: Released video footage of black police officers brutally beating a young black motorist to tire Nichols in early January has reignited calls for police reform.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: Nichols died in hospital three days later. That George Floyd bill, had it been law, might have made some of these police think twice.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: This U.S. Senate and this Congress needs to deal with these civil rights issues of these times, and that is the George Floyd bill and the policing act and we're gonna come out of Memphis and fight like we never fought before to pass federal policing law five officers from the Nichols footage have been charged with second-degree murder and aggravated assault among other charges Memphis Police Department has disbanded the special unit which contained the officers accused.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: Petr Prevel will be the Czech Republic's new president,

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: after confidently defeating his opponent, former Prime Minister Andrei Babis, in a runoff vote which ended Saturday afternoon.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: On stage, the 61-year-old retired general thanked the people who cast ballots in this election and said that truth and humility won.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: The new president will take his oath on March 9th after his predecessor, Milos Zeman, held office for 10 years and was considered by many to be a Euro-skeptic politician.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: With the election of Petr Pavel, the Czech Republic will once again have a clearly pro-Western president.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: The former general supports the introduction of the Euro, military aid to Ukraine and, as he said during the campaign, he's not opposed to the legalization of same-sex marriage.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: Adam Magyar, Euronews, Prague, Czech Republic.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: As Israelis hold vigils to remember those shot dead outside a synagogue in Jerusalem,

sentences.sentence: This amid escalating violence in the occupied Palestinian territory.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: It's a move that has been seen as collective punishment and one that could further increase violence.

sentences.sentence: Our response will be strong, swift and precise, Netanyahu says.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: Thousands of Israelis gathered in Tel Aviv on Saturday for a fourth consecutive weekend of protests against Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu's government.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: In the face of growing unrest and some of the deadliest attacks both Israel and the occupied West Bank has seen in years, Netanyahu is planning to overhaul the judicial system amid his ongoing corruption trial.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: While the new law will need to be passed in Parliament, these protesters fear the move will bring an end to democracy.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: will bring an end to democracy. The next election will be America's last chance for salvation.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: This was former US President Donald Trump's message to his supporters as he attempted to kick off his election campaign on Saturday.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: A few hundred supporters turned out to see the Republican in South Carolina, but some have slammed the politician for failing to make any public appearances since he announced he was running for office last November.
